body_html:
@soumith I disagree with this decision.

Coming from Lua Torch, I was expecting this to work:

model = nn.Sequential(nn.Embedding(opt.vocabsize, opt.inputsize))

inputsize = opt.inputsize
for rnnsize in opt.rnnsize:
	model.add_module(nn.LSTM(inputsize, rnnsize, 1))
	inputsize = rnnsize

Instead, I had to write this

layers = [nn.Embedding(opt.vocabsize, opt.inputsize)]

inputsize = opt.inputsize
for rnnsize in opt.rnnsize:
	layers.append(nn.LSTM(inputsize, rnnsize, 1))
	inputsize = rnnsize

model = nn.Sequential(*layers)

I hope there is a good reason for this design change.

body:
@soumith I disagree with this decision.

Coming from Lua Torch, I was expecting this to work:
```
model = nn.Sequential(nn.Embedding(opt.vocabsize, opt.inputsize))

inputsize = opt.inputsize
for rnnsize in opt.rnnsize:
	model.add_module(nn.LSTM(inputsize, rnnsize, 1))
	inputsize = rnnsize
```
Instead, I had to write this
```
layers = [nn.Embedding(opt.vocabsize, opt.inputsize)]

inputsize = opt.inputsize
for rnnsize in opt.rnnsize:
	layers.append(nn.LSTM(inputsize, rnnsize, 1))
	inputsize = rnnsize

model = nn.Sequential(*layers)
```
I hope there is a good reason for this design change.
